metadata.title: CVE-2022-32893 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds write issue was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 15.6.1 and iPadOS 15.6.1, macOS Monterey 12.5.1, Safari 15.6.1. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32893` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.37.91-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.37.91-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-5.0 - 2.37.91-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.37.91-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.37.91-1
gir1.2-webkit2-5.0 - 2.37.91-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.37.91-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.37.91-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.37.91-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-5.0-0 - 2.37.91-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.37.91-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.37.91-1
libwebkit2gtk-5.0-0 - 2.37.91-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.37.91-1
No subscription required

notes.note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.37.91-1').
